Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre; exterior: narrow brown line at top of rim, reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior (Williams 1983, 169). Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 170, no. 230)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 736, no. 963)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1892) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
